transcript_chunks.text: horizon forbidden west is amazing horizon zero dawn sequel somehow makes its sci-fi post-apocalyptic narrative and fun open-world gameplay better gliding and climbing along with alloy's new polecaster are the big additions that make exploring the beautiful forbidden west a joy as navigating up old world structures and vibrant mountains becomes easier and jumping off of them becomes a literal breeze having an easier time getting around the open world is essential since the map is dense with varied locales really cool settlements to discover and an array of fun activities that you'll lose hours to it keeps itself engaging as well with well-designed traversal puzzles and nail-biting combat that i never got tired of forbidden west story is filled with unexpected twists and turns for horizon that take an already fascinating narrative to the next level if you think you know what's next for aloy in this journey trust me you don't it's not without its faults i ran into minor bugs consistently

take an already fascinating narrative to the next level if you think you know what's next for aloy in this journey trust me you don't it's not without its faults i ran into minor bugs consistently including getting stuck in textures in your standard open world jank there's also a few story moments that i found in satisfying as well as a group of newly introduced characters that at points feel like they're from an entirely different game but these complaints are minor when measured against the places where the game succeeds you can hear our in-depth review on the new episode of kind of funny gamescast but in short
